item.title: [297] It's Over Edition
item.description:
>>148446828

TB: Taylor Walls drew a bases-loaded walk in the eighth to break a tie as the Rays edged the Brewers 4-3 on Friday
NYM: Clay Holmes allowed three hits and one run with three walks and five strikeouts over six innings in a 7-2 win over the Cubs
STL: Erick Fedde tossed his first career shutout against his former team as the Cardinals crushed the Nationals 10-0 on Friday
CIN: Reds transferred INF/OF Tyler Callihan to the 60-day injured list
SD: Padres acquired RHP Andrew Moore and cash considerations from the Reds for 1B/OF Connor Joe
DET: Colt Keith went 2-for-3 with a run scored and an RBI on Friday night, leading the Tigers to a 2-1 victory over the Rangers and their fifth consecutive victory
PIT: Bailey Falter shut out the Braves for six innings in the Pirates’ 3-2 victory Friday
CWS: According to Vinnie Duber, the White Sox plan to promote top prospect Tim Elko on Saturday

item.title: [104] /fglt/ - Friendly GNU/Linux Thread
item.description:
Users of all levels are welcome to ask questions about GNU/Linux and share their experiences.

*** Please be civil, notice the "Friendly" in every Friendly GNU/Linux Thread ***

Before asking for help, please check our list of resources.

If you would like to try out GNU/Linux you can do one of the following:
0) Install a GNU/Linux distribution of your choice in a Virtual Machine.
1) Use a live image and to boot directly into the GNU/Linux distribution without installing anything.
2) Dual boot the GNU/Linux distribution of your choice along with Windows or macOS.
3) Go balls deep and replace everything with GNU/Linux.

Resources: Please spend at least a minute to check a web search engine with your question.
Many free software projects have active mailing lists.

$ man %command%
$ info %command%
$ %command% -h/--help
$ help %builtin/keyword%

Don't know what to look for?
$ apropos %something%

Check the Wikis (most troubleshoots work for all distros):
https://wiki.archlinux.org
https://wiki.gentoo.org

/g/'s Wiki on GNU/Linux:
https://igwiki.lyci.de/wiki/Category:GNU/Linux

>What distro should I choose?
https://igwiki.lyci.de/wiki/Babbies_First_Linux
>What are some cool programs?
https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/list_of_applications
https://directory.fsf.org/wiki/Main_Page
https://suckless.org/rocks/
>What are some cool terminal commands?
https://www.commandlinefu.com/commands/browse
https://cheat.sh/
>Where can I learn the command line?
https://mywiki.wooledge.org/BashGuide
https://www.grymoire.com/Unix/
https://overthewire.org/wargames/bandit
>Where can I learn more about Free Software?
https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/philosophy.html
>How to break out of the botnet?
https://prism-break.org/en/categories/gnu-linux

/fglt/'s website:
https://fglt.nl

GNU/Linux Games:
>>>/t/1175569
>>>/vg/lgg

IRC: #sqt on Rizon
https://fglt.nl/irc.html

item.title: [ 88] AI Pokemon Thread /NAPT/ Thread 184: Enchanting Bellelba Edition
item.description:
This is a general thread for people to post their AI art, and make requests from others who may want to attempt making their own Pokemon related gens.

NovelAI is a paid AI generator. Opus tier users have "unlimited" Small/Normal generations, though editing tools require credits.

Microsoft's Bing AI is a free image generator that is powered by DALL·E 3.

Civitai is free using its ‘buzz’ currency. You get about 50 every day plus more for liking models and gens.
>civitai.com

Otaiku is a (mostly) free mobile app. An ad watch is required between each image generation unless you pay.
>ailla.biz/otaiku

Tensor is free to use as well, although you are limited to how many gens you can make per day.
>https://tensor.art/

Local Generation using Stable Diffusion requires a decent video card. Guides for local genning can be found in the /g/ threads:
>>>/g/sdg
>>>/g/ldg
Other Stable Diffusion threads are on: /h/, /e/, /d/, /b/, /vt/, /aco/, /trash/

Hailuo AI takes uploaded art and animates them based on the prompts you get. You get a 3-day free trial, followed by roughly 3 free gens a day afterward. Subscription plans are available.
>https://hailuoai.video/

Pastebin of Pokemon artists:
>https://pastebin.com/U0mmK3Tm (embed)

Characters with under 300 images will require more tags to have them look correct. This is a list of all Pokemon characters with over 300 images:
>https://danbooru.donmai.us/posts?tags=*_%28pokemon%29+&z=5

If you plan on sharing multiple images together, we'd recommend posting just one, and give links for the rest. This way we can conserve space.

This is a locally run html tool provided by ThatOneAiAnon. It keeps track of all artists you like and turns Danbooru's entire tag system in a collapsible list of buttons. You can edit all the js, css, html code to modify the tool. (Ask him for updated versions or more Nai4 tools)
>mega .nz/file/67xwTRSB#m0fPUmJRaWd3oh47gt6nw2LKNMe820TaiKdXTAhx8tI

Previous Thread:>>57762891

Original filename: 1746721333547095.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 48] the algorithm knows
item.description:
when you feel sad there is something subconsciously different about the way you scroll, imperceptible to you, but perceptible to the algorithm which will then serve you "sad" reels. you can even pretend to "scroll sadly" and the algorithm will know to show you sad content just by scrolling behavior and 0 interaction with likes or comments.

algo is scarier than ai DESU

item.title: [119] /nrl/ - Rugby League General - Super Saturday - round 10
item.description:
Gameface edition

NRL
>GAME 1
Canberra Raiders v Canterbury Bulldogs
3:00pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
GIO Stadium, Canberra
2.67-2.21
>A top of the table blockbuster kicks off Super Saturday. The Raiders pulled off a dramatic 20-18 win over the Storm last weekend. The Bulldogs also impressed, overcoming a disrupted lineup to defeat the Titans 38-18, despite being without several key players through suspension. Last time the Bulldogs won at GIO Stadium was 10 years ago.
Raiders 1-12 2.85
Raiders 13+ 3.20
Bulldogs 1-12 3.25
Bulldogs 13+ 5.60
Raiders -2.5 1.90 Bulldogs +2.5 1.90

>GAME 2
St George-Illawarra Dragons v New Zealand Warriors
5:30pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
WIN Stadium, Wollongong
2.13-1.72
>2025's surprise packets, Let’s Gone, sit in third as they take on an inconsistent side striving to bounce back to form. The in-form Warriors are eyeing a fourth consecutive win as they travel to Wollongong to face a Dragons side that continues to struggle for consistency. The Dragons suffered a frustrating defeat to the Tigers, undermined by crucial lapses just before half-time. The Warriors impressed in a gritty win over the Cowboys, pushing them up to third on the ladder despite some injury setbacks.
Dragons 1-12 3.30
Dragons 13+ 4.80
Warriors 1-12 2.90
Warriors 13+ 3.50
Dragons +2.5 1.81 Warriors -2.5 2.00

>GAME 3
North Queensland Cowboys v Penrith Panthers
7:35pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
Queensland Country Bank Stadium, Townsville
2.37-1.59
>The Panthers are aiming to build momentum after a season-best showing, while the Cowboys look to repeat their earlier upset over the reigning premiers, this time on home turf. North Queensland suffered a tough loss to the Warriors, continuing their up-and-down campaign. Penrith delivered their most complete performance of the season in Magic Round, thumping the Broncos and climbing off the foot of the ladder.
Cowboys 1-12 3.50
Cowboys 13+ 5.60
Panthers 1-12 2.90
Panthers 13+ 3.00
Cowboys +3.5 1.98 Panthers -3.5 1.83

Original filename: Game_face.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 64] Luigi was right
item.description:
>The group, which is seeking unspecified damages, argued that the public backlash [to the shooting] prevented the company from pursuing "the aggressive, anti-consumer tactics that it would need to achieve" its earnings goals.

https://www.cnbc.com/2025/05/08/unitedhealthcare-sued-by-shareholders-over-reaction-to-ceos-killing.html

A group of investors sued UnitedHealthcare Group

on Wednesday, accusing the company of misleading them after the killing of its CEO, Brian Thompson.

The class action lawsuit — filed in the Southern District of New York — accuses the health insurance company of not initially adjusting their 2025 net earning outlook to factor in how Thompson's killing would affect their operations.

On Dec. 3 — a day before Thompson was fatally shot — the company issued guidance that included net earnings of $28.15 to $28.65 per share and adjusted net earnings of $29.50 to $30.00 per share, the suit notes. And on January 16, the company announced that it was sticking with its old forecast.

The investors described this as "materially false and misleading," pointing to the immense public scrutiny the company and the broader health insurance industry experienced in the wake of Thompson's killing.

The group, which is seeking unspecified damages, argued that the public backlash prevented the company from pursuing "the aggressive, anti-consumer tactics that it would need to achieve" its earnings goals.

"As such, the Company was deliberately reckless in doubling down on its previously issued guidance," the suit reads.

Original filename: file.jpg

item.title: [459] /co/ General Drawthread
item.description:
>Provide References for all requested characters and keep them to one image/post
>Keep requests /co/ related and keep them concise.
>General OC discussion belongs in "Work on your art" and the Donut Steel threads.
>However, OC requests are allowed as long as they aren't /trash/ material or fanfiction. If it's not /coc/ you must provide a link to the comic or cartoon.
>Be patient and take it easy! Don't forget to check the booru to see if your request was filled.
>Drawfriends, don't hold back.
>If a post breaks the rules, DO report and hide it. DON'T respond to it.
>Keep art critique short, otherwise take it to the Batman thread.
>No one is entitled to a request delivery.
>Don't bump or "second", "third", etc. requests. They eat up the post limit.
>No spam.
>Don't fight spam with spam.
>No begging.
>No AI deliveries, no AI discussion. Take them where they're wanted.
>To make the new Drawthread, wait for page 10 at bump limit.
>Have fun!

item.title: [438] Viv could've had a more interesting story if she portrayed her demons in Helluv
item.description:
Viv could've had a more interesting story if she portrayed her demons in Helluva Boss existing under an oppressive culture that rewards cruelty and cynicism while discouraging sincere affection and love resulting in many hellborn quickly melting in response to genuine empathy like viltrumites. It would have even fit her liberal ideals of fighting against oppressive power structures. I find it notable and odd then that her characters not only rub elbows with those in power so often but that said authority figures are portrayed so sympathetically and benevolently. We still see shades of her wanting to portray Blitzo as a "working class hero" but the narrative she set up is (unsurprisingly) schizophrenic and directionless.
Also Stolas is a shit.

Original filename: nword.png

item.title: [106] /tpg/ /rcg/ - Theme Park & Roller Coaster General
item.description:
Disneyland Abu Dhabi Edition

>Last Thread: >>2779327

>What is this thread? Why are there two companies?
Disney parks were initially founded as a way to celebrate the culture and history of America and provide middle class families with a fun-filled immersive experience. While theme parks are the main focus of these threads (and the title of the general) there is also discussion on other roller coasters & rides, as well as the parks themselves and trip planning too. That's where /rcg/ comes in.
>Can I talk about Disney/Universal parks in this thread?
Absolutely! Disney and Universal are currently competing for the Orlando theme park market and beyond! Universal is opening new resorts all around the US and new continents!

Thread Pro Tip: Talk about theme parks!

Park Crowd Tracker:
>https://queue-times.com/en-US/parks

Roller Coaster Database:
>https://rcdb.com/

Amusement Park News Sites:

>https://www.allears.net
>https://www.mousesteps.com

>News
Disneyland Abu Dhabi announced as Disney's 7th resort and first in Middle East. Miral Group (United Arab Emirates government) will entirely fund and operate the park
https://disneyparksblog.com/disney-experiences/disney-announces-abu-dhabi-theme-park/
Epic Universe officially opens in two weeks, but previews are showing heavy operational issues
https://wdwnt.com/2025/05/breaking-harry-potter-and-the-battle-at-the-ministry-to-temporarily-close-during-final-week-of-epic-universe-previews/
And your local theme parks are probably open for weekends now

item.title: [133] Millennial cuisine has been defined by shallow gimmicks, a very faux sentimenta
item.description:
Millennial cuisine has been defined by shallow gimmicks, a very faux sentimentality, and trying to reinvent the wheel (look to the burger/pizza restaurants they open) . Seemingly all of these things have led to a toxic culture of shallow presentation and verbose moralizing. Nothing good or great has come out of it other then the circus freaks who call themselves chiefs.
What will Zoomer cosine look like? I don't reckon it will be as gaudy or preachy as the Millennial but I am in no high hopes of any sort of major change. Ideally there will be a pre-1970 French cuisine revival but I won't hold my breath.

Original filename: gross.jpg

item.title: [ 37] Hey voyagers, The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread
item.description:
Hey voyagers,

The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread open for suggestions:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/trv/ is a slow board, so don't expect immediate responses. CHECK THE CATALOG – you might find threads already discussing topics you're interested in.

Before asking for suggestions, tell /trv/ about your:
>Budget
>Interests
>Level of understanding of the local language(s)
This makes it easier to give quality advice. Of course, keep your posts travel related.

For all other matters:
General culture questions >>>/int/
Politics discussion >>>/pol/
Transportation discussion >>>/n/
Outdoors-related discussion >>>/out/

For more information about safety, planning and other miscellaneous topics, check out the pastebin:

https://pastebin.com/yR1SAr3s

Note: Discussions of prostitution or sex tourism are not permitted on /trv/.

item.title: [ 62] Buenos Aires Argentina
item.description:
Anyone know of stuff to do in Buenos Aires? I'm going to be there for about a month from mid-April to mid-May and most of that time will be free time.

Things I like: fishing, butterflies, tits, food.
